algorithm_technique: Iterate through the target array, summing the positive differences between adjacent elements.
Each positive difference represents a new subarray increment needed.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum operations to make an array of zeros equal to a target array by incrementing subarrays.
problem_summary_technical: Sum of positive differences between adjacent elements in the target array, plus the first element.
key_insights: The key insight is that an increment operation on a subarray [i, j] affects all elements from i to j.
When we encounter a target value `target[i]` that is greater than `target[i-1]`, we need `target[i] - target[i-1]` new operations starting at index `i`.
The total operations are the sum of these necessary increments across the array.
